title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wickham H, Chang W, Flight R, Müller K, Hester J (2025). sessioninfo: R Session Information. R package version 1.2.2.9000, https://sessioninfo.r-lib.org, https://github.com/r-lib/sessioninfo#readme.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sessioninfo: R Session Information},   author = {Hadley Wickham and Winston Chang and Robert Flight and Kirill Müller and Jim Hester},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.2.2.9000,     https://sessioninfo.r-lib.org},   url = {https://github.com/r-lib/sessioninfo#readme}, }

title: R Session Information
text: R Session Information Query print information current R session. similar utils::sessionInfo(), includes information packages, installed .

title: R Session Information
text: Additional platform details: time zone, pandoc version, RStudio version, etc. Information package sources, e.g. GitHub repo hash packages installed GitHub. Highlight package installation problems, e.g. loaded -disk versions different, MD5 checksum package DLL wrong, etc. Highlight packages unusual sources. Information external software via external_info(). Information Python configuration reticulate package loaded configured. Information package libraries. Compare two session info outputs session_diff() function. Option show loaded (default), attached installed packages, recursive dependencies specified packages.

text: Install released version CRAN development version GitHub:

title: R Session Information
text: session_diff() can retrieve session info URL clipboard compare current session information:

title: R Session Information
text: Please note sessioninfo project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: R Session Information
text: GPL-2

title: Information about related software — external_info
text: Information related software

title: Information about related software — external_info
text: list elements: cairo: cairo version string. libpng: png version string. jpeg: jpeg version string. tiff: tiff library version string used. tcl: tcl version string. curl: curl version string. zlib: zlib version string. bzlib: zlib version string. xz: zlib version string. PCRE: Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) version string. ICU: International Components Unicode (ICU) version string. TRE: TRE version string. iconv: iconv version string. readline: readline version string. BLAS: path implementation BLAS use. LAPACK: path implementation LAPACK use.

title: Information about related software — external_info
text: Note calling function attempt load tcltk grDevices packages.

what: Human readable name of the current operating system — os_name
title: Human readable name of the current operating system — os_name
text: example Windows 8.1 instead Windows version 6.3.9600. macOS includes code names, Linux includes distribution names codenames appropriate.

title: Human readable name of the current operating system — os_name
Human readable name of the current operating system — os_name
text: character scalar.

title: Human readable name of the current operating system — os_name
text: uses utils::sessionInfo(), simplifies output bit Windows, make concise.

what: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info
title: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info
text: Information currently loaded packages, chosen set

title: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info
code: package_info(   pkgs = c("loaded", "attached", "installed")[1],   include_base = FALSE,   dependencies = NA )

title: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info
text: pkgs packages show. may : NULL "loaded": show loaded packages, "attached": show attached packages, "installed": show installed packages, character vector package names. (hard) dependencies also shown default, see dependencies argument. include_base Include base packages summary? default false since base packages always match R version. dependencies Whether include (recursive) dependencies well. See dependencies argument utils::install.packages().

title: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info
text: data frame columns: package: package name. ondiskversion: package version (disk, sometimes loaded version). loadedversion: package version. version loaded namespace pkgs NULL, version package disk otherwise. two almost always , though. path: path package disk. loadedpath: path package originally loaded . attached: logical, whether package attached search path. is_base: logical, whether package base package. date: date package installed built, UTC. source: package installed . E.g. CRAN, GitHub, local (local machine), etc. md5ok: Whether MD5 hashes package DLL files match, Windows. NA platforms. library: factor, package library package loaded . loaded packages, (factor representation ) loadedpath, others path. See session_info() description printed columns package_info (opposed returned columns).

title: Information about the currently loaded packages, or about a chosen set — package_info

what: Information about the current platform — platform_info
title: Information about the current platform — platform_info
text: Information current platform

title: Information about the current platform — platform_info
Information about the current platform — platform_info
text: list elements: version: R version string. os: OS name human readable format, see os_name(). system: CPU, machine readable OS name, separated comma. ui: user interface, e.g. Rgui, RTerm, etc. see GUI base::.Platform. hostname: name machine known network, see nodename base::Sys.info(). privacy, included sessioninfo.include_hostname option set TRUE. language: current language setting. LANGUAGE environment variable, set, (EN) unset. collate: Collation rule, current locale. ctype: Native character encoding, current locale. tz: current time zone. date: current date. rstudio: RStudio format string, added RStudio. pandoc: pandoc version path quarto: quarto version path

title: Information about the current platform — platform_info
Python configuration — python_info
text: Python configuration

title: Python configuration — python_info
text: Returns reticulate::py_config object, also python_info class. named list values. reticulate installed Python configured, return python_info object character vector, py_config class.

what: Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
title: Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
text: Compare session information two sources

title: Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
text: old, new session_info object (return value session_info()), pointer session_info() output. See details . packages compare package info old new: "diff": line diffs, style diff -u "merge": merge information one data frame, one row per package. package version source compared. ... Passed new session_info() calls.

title: Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
text: Various way specify old new: session_info object. "local" runs session_info() current session, uses output. "clipboard" takes session info system clipboard. clipboard contains URL, followed download session info. URL inspect results GitHub Actions job. Typically form:   Internally, URL parsed can look job id, get log file, extract session info. URL starting http:// https://. session_diff() searches HTML (text) page session info header find session info.

title: Compare session information from two sources — session_diff
Print session information — session_info
text: utils::sessionInfo() re-written scratch exclude data rarely useful (e.g., full collate string base packages loaded) include stuff like know (e.g., package installed ).

title: Print session information — session_info
code: session_info(   pkgs = c("loaded", "attached", "installed")[1],   include_base = FALSE,   info = c("auto", "all", "platform", "packages", "python", "external"),   dependencies = NA,   to_file = FALSE )

title: Print session information — session_info
text: pkgs packages show. may : NULL "loaded": show loaded packages, "attached": show attached packages, "installed": show installed packages, character vector package names. (hard) dependencies also shown default, see dependencies argument. include_base Include base packages summary? default false since base packages always match R version. info information show, can "auto" choose automatically, "" show everything, character vector elements : "platform": show platform information via platform_info(), "packages": show package information via package_info(), "python": show Python configuration via python_info(), "external": show information external software, via external_info(). dependencies Whether include (recursive) dependencies well. See dependencies argument utils::install.packages(). to_file Whether print session information file. TRUE name file session-info.txt, to_file may also string specify file name.

title: Print session information — session_info
text: session_info object. to_file FALSE returned invisibly. (print file screen, use (session_info(to_file = TRUE)).)

title: Print session information — session_info
text: Columns printed package list: package: package name *: whether package attached search path version: package version. version marked (!) means loaded -disk version package different. date: package built, information available. Date/Publication Built field DESCRIPTION. (usually added automatically R.) Sometimes data available, NA. source: package built installed , available. Examples: CRAN (R 3.3.2), Github (r-lib/pkgbuild@8aab60b), Bioconductor, local. See package_info() list columns data frame returned (opposed printed).

title: sessioninfo: R Session Information — sessioninfo-package
text: Query print information current R session. similar 'utils::sessionInfo()', includes information packages, installed .

title: sessioninfo: R Session Information — sessioninfo-package
text: Maintainer: Gábor Csárdi csardi.gabor@gmail.com Authors: Hadley Wickham Winston Chang Robert Flight Kirill Müller Jim Hester contributors: R Core team [contributor] Posit Software, PBC [copyright holder, funder]

title: sessioninfo (development version)
text: session_info() longer produces error info length > 1 (@nash-delcamp-slp, #96). Update pkgdown url sessioninfo.r-lib.org. session_diff() now accepts URL GitHub Actions log source new /old (@jennybc, #68). session_info() output now includes explanation symbol highlighting packages attached search path (@IndrajeetPatil). session_info() platform_info() now print host name sessioninfo.include_hostname global option set TRUE (@certara-jcraig, #99).

title: sessioninfo 1.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-12-06 version add emoji hash output. source column output data frame package_info() (also part session_info()), now contains full SHA packages installed GitHub, instead first seven characters. makes easier use SHA programmatically. Note affect formatting printing, still use abbreviated SHA. (@muschellij2, #61). RStudio Package Manager (RSPM) repository sources now shown source column, set Repository field DESCRIPTION.

title: sessioninfo 1.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-02 package_info() session_info() now fail version number installed package invalid. Better aliases list attached, loaded installed packages package_inf() session_info().

title: sessioninfo 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-31 New function external_info(), information external software. can also requested new info argument session_info() (@llrs). New function python_info(), information Python configuration. automatically included session_info() reticulate package loaded Python available. can also request manually via new info argument session_info() (#33). output session_info() now emoji hash, consisting three emojis. allows quick comparison two session infos (#26). *_info() functions use ANSI colors systems support . particular, highlights unusual package versions sources, possible package problems (#3). New session_diff() function, compare two session infos various sources (#6). session_info() new argument named info, select parts session information printed. session_info() now to_file argument, write output file (#30). session_inf() dependencies argument now, passes package_info(). package_info() session_info() can now list attached installed packages, see pkgs argument manual details (#42). platform_info() session_info() now include Windows build number output (#40). sessioninfo now never wraps output screen narrow (#31). *_info() functions format() S3 method now. platform_info() session_info() now include RStudio version R session RStudio (#29). source column package list now informative.

title: sessioninfo 1.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-11-05 package_info() session_info() now detect locally installed packages correctly empty biocViews field `DESCRIPTION (@llrs, #25) package_info() session_info() now handle case loaded package removed disk.

title: sessioninfo 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-09-25 package_info() now dependencies argument, filter type dependent packages output (#22). session_info() package_info() now show library search path, also library package loaded . also warn -disk version package different path loaded version (#9, #20). package_info()’s ondiskversion entry now correct. session_info() package_info() now verify MD5 hashes DLL files Windows, warns micmatches, usually broken packages (#12, #16). use now cli package, instead clisymbols, fixes printing bugs LaTeX documents (#14). session_info() platform_info() now include LC_CTYPE locale category (@patperry, #11) session_info() package_info() now print source CRAN packages uppercase, always, even installed devtools. session_info() platform_info() now handle case utils::sessionInfo()$running NULL (@HenrikBengtsson, #7). session_info() package_info() now list loaded versions namespaces already loaded. makes difference pkgs argument given (#4). consult max.print option, platform package info (@jennybc, #13).

title: sessioninfo 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-21 First public release.
